title: Poster, Tops, 1980
inscribed: Printed in purple, lower margin: POSTER CONCEPT, DESIGN & ILLUSTRATION: WOODY PIRTLE, INC./COPY: MARY KECK/TYPOGRAPHY/PAPER: OLMSTEAD-KIRK/PRINTING: WILLIAMSON PRINTING.
description: Rhomboid with saw tooth border, containing a colorful top toy spinning on its point; above, colorful letters: TOPS. Posters upper edge in gray with yellow text: DALLAS ADVERTISING LEAGUE 1980; lower edge in gray; lower section with five rhomboids containing sequential tops, from an empty rhomboid to a full view of a top. Text in purple on a bias: Get spinning. And be the first on / your block to search every / nook and cranny. Clean out / all your closets. And dig / deep in your pockets. / To come up with the best of your / best work. The kind that could / win a 1980 Dallas Ad League / award. We’re looking, high / and low, for work that’ll / get heads turning. Be- / cause we want this year’s show to / be better than ever. To be a veri- / table whirl of brilliant color / and design and concept. All / balanced just right. And / showing off all the / skills it takes to get a great idea off / the ground. You can expect our / judges to be looking for terrific / logos and letterheads. / Memorable radio and tv. / Outstanding cam- / paigns. And more. Each with that / elusive something that makes / it work. And work circles / around everything else. So / say you’ll compete. / Send us your finest / and most moving work. But be / very down to earth as your pick / out your highest achieve- / ments for the year. And / you just might earn / that special honor, / applause, and / glory, that / could put / your on / top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Tops, 1980. Lithograph on paper. 
Gift of Various Donors. 1981-29-48.
